general: ping` → checks the latency of the bot
stock <ticker>` → sends info about the stock <ticker>
crypto <symbol>` → sends info about the crypto <symbol>
init` → creates a game account and start the tutorial
addsavings <amount>` → deposits money into your savings account
takesavings <amount>` → withdraws money from your savings account
passport: Mention (@) someone to see their passport
init: Initializes your investing account, and begins the tutorial
buy: *- stocks can only be bought in integer quantities*
*- if stocks are bought while markets are closed, they will be pre-ordered*
*- crypto can be bought with up to 4 decimal places*
sell: *- stocks can only be sold in integer quantities*
*- if stocks are sold while markets are closed, they will be pre-sold*
*- crypto can be bought with up to 4 decimal places*
list: *- <page> defaults to `1` if no value is provided, or if <type> is `all`*
*- each page shows up to 10 items*
balance: Shows your cash and net worth

infoSavings.Overview:
Savings are a no-risk, tax-free way to earn money
There are no fees, and an APY of 2% is offered, meaning that if you put $100,000 into a savings account, you would have $102,000 after 1 year
infoSavings.Interest:
Interest is earned on an hourly basis, at a rate of +${config.savingsInterest}%/h
This interest is compounding, meaning that you earn interest on your interest
infoSavings.Timing:
To prevent cheating, interest begins accumulating on the hour after you bought it
For example, if you put money in at 2:45, it is treated as if it was put in at 3:00, and therefore at 4 you would see an increase
Adding money to a savings account is equivalent to taking it all out and putting it back in + whatever else you added
All gains from savings are kept, but after depositing, you must wait until the next hour strikes before it begins earning interest (as per usual)
infoSavings.footer: All in all, savings are complicated, so feel free to ask questions. Good luck!
